item.title: StreamAnalyse-BloomFilter
item.author: liudongdong1
item.description: A Bloom filter is a space-efficient probabilistic data structure, conceived by Burton Howard Bloom in 1970, that is used to test whether an element is a member of a set. a query returns either “possibly in set” or “definitely not in set”. the shortcoming of this structure is that the more elements that are added to the set, the larger the probability of false positives. and , Bloom filters do
